Question: Which of the following is a segmentation task?
Answer: Determining which areas of the brain have tumor from an MRI
Determining whether there is a mass in a chest X-ray
None of the above
Determining whether a brain tumor is present in an MRI
Correct: Determining which areas of the brain have tumor from an MRI

Question:
What is the MAIN disadvantage of processing each MRI slice independently using a 2D segmentation model (as mentioned in the lecture)?  

Hint: watch the lecture video "Segmentation" to help you answer this question.
Answer: 3D models are always better than 2D models
It is difficult to register slices of MRI models
None of the above
You lose some context between slices
Correct: You lose some context between slices

Question: The U-net consists of...
Answer: A contracting path followed by an expanding path
Just an expanding path
An expanding path followed by a contracting path
Just a contracting path
Correct: A contracting path followed by an expanding path

Question: An X-ray classification model is developed on data from US hospitals and is later tested on an external dataset from Latin America. Which if the following do you expect?
Answer: Performance remains unchanged
None of the above
Performance improves on the new dataset
Performance drops on the new dataset
Correct: Performance drops on the new dataset

Question: Which of the following is an example of a prospective study?
Answer: A model is trained and tested on a dataset of X-rays collected between 2001 and 2010
A model is deployed for 1 year in an emergency room and its performance over that time is evaluated
None of the above
A model is trained on data collected between 2001 and 2010 and then validated on data collected between 2011 and 2013
Correct: A model is deployed for 1 year in an emergency room and its performance over that time is evaluated
